title: Progressive Licensed Cocoa Buyers Association launched
text:
12 July 2015 16:36 CET Progressive Licensed Cocoa Buyers Association launched By MyJoyOnline 
Progressive Licensed Cocoa Buyers Association (PLCBA) has been launched in Accra. 
The Association formed by fourteen indigenous Licenced Cocoa Buying Companies is to advance each other’s welfare and to raise adequate funding to purchase cocoa in their individual capacities. 
The (PLCBA) was established as a company limited by guarantee under the Ghana Company’s code 1963 (Act 179) on 20th May 2014. 
Speaking at the launch, President of the Association said coming together to form the Association, member companies can pull resources together to attract large amount of funding on better conditions than they individually get and also buy cocoa in larger volumes. 
He indicated that unity of the Association could also help members attract high level professionals to manage successfully the businesses of member companies through the Secretariat of the Association and help to reduce cost of operations.
